definitions.definition: (of an object, especially a ball) move quickly up, back, or away from a surface after hitting it; rebound (once or repeatedly).
examples: the ball bounced off the rim

definitions.definition: (of light, sound, or an electronic signal) come into contact with an object or surface and be reflected.
examples: short sound waves bounce off even small objects

definitions.definition: (of an e-mail) be returned to its sender after failing to reach its destination.
examples: I tried to e-mail him, but the message bounced

definitions.definition: recover well after a setback.
examples: he was admired for his ability to bounce back from injury
synonyms: be on the mend; Moreperk up
liven up; informalbuck up "despite our optimistic predictions

definitions.definition: hit a ball that bounces before reaching a fielder.
examples: bouncing out with the bases loaded

definitions.definition: (of a person) jump repeatedly up and down, typically on something springy.
examples: bouncing up and down on the mattress

definitions.definition: (of a thing) move up and down while remaining essentially in the same position.
examples: the gangplank bounced under his confident step

definitions.definition: cause (a child) to move lightly up and down on one's knee as a game.
examples: I remember how you used to bounce me on your knee

definitions.definition: move in an energetic or happy manner.
examples: Linda bounced in through the open front door

definitions.definition: (of a vehicle) move jerkily along a bumpy surface.
examples: the car bounced down the narrow track

definitions.definition: (of a check) be returned by a bank when there are insufficient funds to meet it.
write (a check) on insufficient funds.
eject (a troublemaker) forcibly from a nightclub or similar establishment.
dismiss (someone) from a job.
examples: those who put in a dismal performance will be bounced from the tour

definitions.definition: a rebound of a ball or other object.
examples: a bad bounce caused the ball to get away from the second baseman

definitions.definition: the power of rebounding.
an act of jumping or an instance of being moved up and down.
examples: every bounce of the truck brought them into fresh contact
synonyms: ricochet "he caught the ball after a single bounce"

definitions.definition: a sudden rise in the level of something.
examples: economists agree that there could be a bounce in prices next year

definitions.definition: exuberant self-confidence.
examples: the bounce was now back in Jenny's step

definitions.definition: health and body in the hair.
examples: use conditioner to help hair regain its bounce
